Articles.Content:
Hello everyone!

Probably by now you've already noticed the new KSP video on our YouTube channel. And just in case you haven't seen it here's the link

I hope you really enjoy it as it was a fun clip to animate!

D.

Nice work! Just out of curiousity, who designs your promotional and cinematic videos? I ask because I'm a film student, and cinematography is my main focus. Videogame cinematics are a field I'm kinda interested in.

Once again, great work on the video and on the new update! You guys are the most responsive devs to your players that I've ever heard of! Keep up the good work!

Lulz @ the mohawk

Wink wink to a special engineer
This is amazing! Great work, bueno trabajo. I hope we have more clips like this to look forward to
Everyone should recognize the famous Gene "Krantz" Kermann.

Nice work! Just out of curiousity, who designs your promotional and cinematic videos? I ask because I'm a film student, and cinematography is my main focus. Videogame cinematics are a field I'm kinda interested in.

Once again, great work on the video and on the new update! You guys are the most responsive devs to your players that I've ever heard of! Keep up the good work!

Thanks for the comment!!

It was a collaborative process. Adrian came to us and said "We need a new video for our Youtube channel with the Bobak guy" and then we gathered around some ideas. There was actually a script I drafted, but it was too much for what we needed. So we ended up with a single shot at the two kerbals. The rest was the production phase, with the creation of the new set, props and animations.

Hope that answers your question

D.
I love that video lol the are playing ksp during the mission =P god this is the first time i can access the forums in three days because of the click happy people going on with 0.17
This must have been the scene at Squad when .17 went live.
